Brent crude futures fell 23 cents, or 0.4%, to $62.16 a barrel at 11:11 a.m. EDT . U.S. West Texas Intermediate futures fell 14 cents, or 0.2%, to $58.56. Both benchmarks were headed for their lowest closes since May 7 for a second day in a row.
